entry.title: Re - Make the lottery eligible for 20% of ALL the website's earnings (i.e. not just the casino; presumably Rollbit is minting money on other products ...

entry.title: Re Where I could be wrong is if: - Rollbit's casino earnings increase a lot, and / or; - Rollbit increases the % of the casino earnings in the lottery...
Re So at its current $0.035 price, $RLB is: - Expensive on earnings (i.e. >20x annual lottery); and - Supply is decreasing very slowly. I.e. ponzi no ...
entry.summary: Re So at its current $0.035 price, $RLB is: - Expensive on earnings (i.e. >20x annual lottery); and - Supply is decreasing very slowly. I.e. ponzi no gud.

entry.title: Re No surprise, as the RLB price has sky rocketed, RLB staking rate has collapsed. The burn-rates looking forward are likely to be much more modest (s...
entry.summary: Re No surprise, as the RLB price has sky rocketed, RLB staking rate has collapsed. The burn-rates looking forward are likely to be much more modest (say ~5% or less).

entry.title: Re At a high market cap relative to payout, it makes less sense to participate. E.g. $5M annual lottery pool at current $113M RLB market cap, RLB toke...
entry.summary: Re At a high market cap relative to payout, it makes less sense to participate. E.g. $5M annual lottery pool at current $113M RLB market cap, RLB tokenholders are paying >20x the expected value.

entry.title: Re At low market cap of RLB relative to the payout, it makes sense for an extremely high participation rate. E.g. $5M annual lottery pool and $5M RLB ...
entry.summary: Re At low market cap of RLB relative to the payout, it makes sense for an extremely high participation rate. E.g. $5M annual lottery pool and $5M RLB market cap = expected value equals 1.

entry.title: Re Under lower participation rates, the burn rate is less impressive. With 171M RLB currently participating in the lottery, the burn rate nets out to ...
entry.summary: Re Under lower participation rates, the burn rate is less impressive. With 171M RLB currently participating in the lottery, the burn rate nets out to about 3% per year.

entry.title: Re If a high %age of RLB participates in every lottery, the RLB supply is burnt extremely quickly. Assuming the original 5B supply of RLB participated...
entry.summary: Re If a high %age of RLB participates in every lottery, the RLB supply is burnt extremely quickly. Assuming the original 5B supply of RLB participated in every lottery, 45% of the supply would be burned every year (Crude math: 5B tokens x 500 lotteries x 0.1% = ~50%)

entry.title: Re In order to enter the lottery, RLB holders must pay 0.2% of their RLB, half of which is burnt. So 0.1% of the RLB supply participating in the lotte...
entry.summary: Re In order to enter the lottery, RLB holders must pay 0.2% of their RLB, half of which is burnt. So 0.1% of the RLB supply participating in the lottery is burnt every lottery.

entry.title: Re The $RLB token is a claim on 20% of But in order to see that 20% of revenue, RLB holders must stake in a lottery that's held once every 100 #Bitcoi...
entry.summary: Re The $RLB token is a claim on 20% of But in order to see that 20% of revenue, RLB holders must stake in a lottery that's held once every 100 #Bitcoin blocks, or every 15-20 hours. It works out to around 500 lotteries a year. http://rolllbit.com

entry.title: I've been researching the $RLB token and the coin doesn't seem that interesting at >$100M market cap. TLDR: The ponzinomics break down at high market ...
entry.summary: I've been researching the $RLB token and the coin doesn't seem that interesting at >$100M market cap. TLDR: The ponzinomics break down at high market cap of $RLB relative to lottery winnings. Thoughts below. Would love to hear alternative takes.

entry.summary: 《帐户抽象的力量及 RaisePay 钱包的技术概述》：账户抽象，也可以被称为智能合约钱包，尽可能地把操作交给智能合约自动执行，简化用户的使用体验，并降低安全成本。账户抽象一般不需要用户记录私钥，甚至用户都感知不到私钥存在；提供找回钱包的办法；一次多笔签名确认；
